intro: Ambulia dasyantha, commonly known as the velvetleaf ambulia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Ambulia dasyantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
